H0.text: The molecules move at a faster rate as Anita heats a beaker containing water and the temperature of the water increases.

H1.text: The molecules become more massive as the temperature of the water increases when Anita heats a beaker containing water.

H2.text: The molecules expand and become wider as Anita heats a beaker containing water and the temperature of the water increases.

H3.text: The molecules separate into atoms of hydrogen and oxygen is the change that occurs to the water molecules as the temperature of the water increases when Anita heats a beaker containing water.

A4.text: In many statistical physics texts, 'thermal energy' refers to kT, the product of the Boltzmann constant and the absolute temperature, also written as kBT.
